newsitem.title: USA: Union Pacific closes rail near Minneapolis.
newsitem.headline: Union Pacific closes rail near Minneapolis.

text.p: Union Pacific Corp said flooding on the upper Mississippi River has forced the closure of its rail line near the twin cities of Minneapolis-St Paul, Minnesota.
"We are pretty much shut down in the Minneapolis-St Paul areas going south to Mankato, Minnesota," Union Pacific spokesman Ed Trandahl said.
The line was shut down sometime during the weekend due to flooding fed by high water levels on the upper Mississippi and the Minnesota River.
"There has been some cooler weather that came through that area and that will probably help us get back in business a little sooner than if it had just stayed warm," he said.
But he said at this moment he did not know when the track would reopen.
